alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Claiborne, northwestern Hancock, northeastern Campbell and southwestern Lee Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 944 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lot, or 13 miles southeast of Williamsburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrogate, Jellico, Cumberland Gap, Ewing, Arthur, Indian Mountain State Park, Powell River Preserve, Clairfield, White Oak and Rose Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
